# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/dec/18/jabaliya-refugee-camp-gaza-destruction-idf): 
Content: "As well as the large open market at its centre, there were restaurants and schools, two football teams, bakeries and clinics.

[Satellite map of Jabaliya on 8 Oct 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_8_oct_2023_tue_final/giv-4559YJ4SlWz5oDm0)

This footage from 2022 shows people on a packed street in the camp’s main market during Eid al-Fitr celebrations.

[This footage from 2022 shows people on a packed street in the camp’s main market during Eid al-Fitr celebrations.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.mp4)

Between 10.30am and 11.30am on 9 October last year, five Israeli airstrikes tore through the market, killing dozens of people.

[Aftermath of an airstrike in al-Trans area on 9 October 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.mp4)

They were the opening salvoes of a devastating Israeli campaign, conducted in three waves, that has left the camp an unrecognisable wasteland of rubble.

“This year is one of the worst I have experienced,” said 33-year-old Ahlam al-Tlouli, who comes from the Tal al-Zaatar area of the camp. The deadliest, on 31 October, [killed scores of people](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/jabalia-camp-airstrike-gaza)
 and left large craters in the ground at a busy junction.

[Large craters left in ground after Jabaliya was pummelled with airstrikes on 31 October 2023.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.mp4)

Israel said the camp was a command centre for Hamas’s northern brigade and that it had identified Hamas tunnel systems under the camp. “No house, person, tree or stone was spared.”

‘Jabaliya is like hell’
-----------------------

**The third offensive: October 2024 – ongoing**

The heavy damage inflicted on Jabaliya during the second offensive paled in comparison with the destruction levelled since 5 October, when Israeli forces returned in large numbers for a third time.

Over the course of the offensive – which targeted Jabaliya city as well as the camp – whole groupings of buildings have been demolished, replaced in some areas by bulldozed lanes to accommodate Israeli armour and tank berms. In late January, Israel withdrew from the camp.

‘All the houses were in ruins’
------------------------------

**The second offensive: May 2024**

Intermittent clashes continued throughout January despite Israeli claims that Hamas had been defeated in Jabaliya. This footage from April shows damage to buildings along two roads in the camp.

[Damaged buildings in Jabaliya refugee camp.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.mp4)

On 11 May the IDF reported that Hamas had managed to reconstitute its military capabilities, and it issued a new round of evacuation orders to civilians. In footage posted online in recent weeks, bulldozers and backhoes can be seen pulling down structures.

[Backhoe used to pull down building in October 2024.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.mp4)

Some neighbourhoods have almost entirely disappeared, including block 4, which included the camp’s main school complex.

[Satellite image of Block 4 in Jabaliya refugee camp](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_block4_sidebyside_tue_final/giv-45591oPngPow70Km/)

“There are bodies on the roads and under the rubble,” said Mahmoud Basal, 39, a civil defence official. It has an awful momentum.”

Other observers detect a more deliberate agenda in Jabaliya and across northern Gaza: the slow enactment of a scorched earth policy known as the “generals’ plan”, aimed at driving out civilians from areas by declaring them “closed military zones” where anyone who stays is considered a combatant and all aid and other supplies are cut.

Regardless of the intention, whole-scale destruction of neighbourhoods has taken place across the north of Gaza, including in the camp.

[Satellite image of Jabaliya refugee camp from 12 Nov 2024](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_12-nov-2023_tue_final/giv-4559UcmYNSAvUq79)

A document circulated to Israeli combat soldiers in recent weeks, [revealed by the Israeli newspaper Haaretz](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/security-aviation/2024-11-13/ty-article-magazine/.premium/idf-gearing-up-to-remain-in-gaza-until-end-of-2025-at-least-this-is-what-it-looks-like/00000193-2230-d76d-a7db-637196a00000)
, talks of “exposing large areas” – a euphemism, the paper says, for destroying buildings and infrastructure in such a way that Hamas fighters cannot hide in them but no one can live in them either.

Nadia Hardman, a researcher at Human Rights Watch, said HRW had identified a pattern in Jabaliya and across the north of Israeli forces clearing territory for buffer zones and security corridors.

“People can argue whether the campaign of bombing is reckless destruction or part of the hostilities, but taking control of an area and intentionally destroying it looks far more systematic,” Hardman said.

In a statement, the IDF said: “The IDF is currently operating in northern Gaza against terrorist targets due to Hamas’s efforts to restore its operational capabilities in the area … The IDF targets only military objectives. “Homes, streets, health and educational facilities – everything is gone.”

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

2024 engagement in the Gaza Strip

Siege of North GazaPart of the [Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip")
, and the [insurgency in the North Gaza Strip](/wiki/Insurgency_in_the_North_Gaza_Strip "Insurgency in the North Gaza Strip")
 during the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Date | 5 October 2024[\[4\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification1-4)<br>[\[5\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification2-5)<br> – 19 January 2025  <br>(3 months and 2 weeks) |
| Location | [North Gaza Governorate](/wiki/North_Gaza_Governorate "North Gaza Governorate")<br>, [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")<br>, [Palestine](/wiki/Palestine "Palestine") |
| Result | [Ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Israel%E2%80%93Hamas_war_ceasefire "2025 Israel–Hamas war ceasefire")<br> and Israeli withdrawal |

[Palestinian war crimes](/wiki/Palestinian_war_crimes "Palestinian war crimes")<br>    *   [Hostage crisis](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")<br>        *   [2023 prisoner exchange](/wiki/2023_Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_prisoner_exchange "2023 Israeli–Palestinian prisoner exchange")<br>            <br>*   [Israeli war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")<br>    *   [Israeli blockade of Gaza](/wiki/Israeli_blockade_of_the_Gaza_Strip_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Israeli blockade of the Gaza Strip (2023–present)")<br>        *   [Famine](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_famine "Gaza Strip famine")<br>            <br>    *   [AI-assisted targeting](/wiki/AI-assisted_targeting_in_the_Gaza_Strip "AI-assisted targeting in the Gaza Strip")<br>        <br>    *   [Mass detentions](/wiki/Mass_detentions_in_the_Gaza_war "Mass detentions in the Gaza war")<br>        <br>    *   [South Africa v. It began on 5 October 2024 when the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 (IDF) reinvaded [Jabalia](/wiki/Jabalia "Jabalia")
 and [its refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
 for the first time in months since [earlier fighting](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
[\[9\]](#cite_note-bbc.com-9)

The siege was reportedly part of Israel's "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
" to force Palestinians out of northern Gaza by designating it a combat zone and issuing [evacuation orders](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 to civilians under threat of death.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 The IDF imposed a complete siege on northern Gaza, cutting it off from [Gaza City](/wiki/Gaza_City "Gaza City")
 by destroying most of the roads leading south and preventing the [entry of aid](/wiki/Humanitarian_aid_during_the_Gaza_war "Humanitarian aid during the Gaza war")
.[\[20\]](#cite_note-Stray_dogs-20)
[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)
 Evacuations were hindered, however, by [Israeli bombardments](/wiki/Israeli_bombing_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip")
 and [shootings of fleeing civilians](/wiki/Attacks_on_protected_zones_and_civilians_in_Gaza "Attacks on protected zones and civilians in Gaza")
, leaving many trapped.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 Human rights groups raised concerns of [war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")
, and Israeli actions were characterized as ethnic cleansing and [genocide](/wiki/Gaza_genocide "Gaza genocide")
.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-24)
 Israel [attacked hospitals](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
 and [medical infrastructure](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
, as international bodies warned of disastrous conditions in Jabalia.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)

Israel's siege extended to Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun, with officials stating no food had been allowed to enter either town or Jabalia.[\[26\]](#cite_note-26)
 A senior [COGAT](/wiki/Coordinator_of_Government_Activities_in_the_Territories "Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories")
 official stated that aid delivery was being confined to Gaza City because there was "no population" remaining in Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun.[\[27\]](#cite_note-27)

A [ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire "2025 Gaza war ceasefire")
 between Israel and Hamas came into effect on 19 January 2025, with the IDF withdrawing from northern Gaza to a buffer zone along the [Gaza Strip–Israel border](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_barrier "Gaza–Israel barrier")
 on that same day.[\[28\]](#cite_note-:5-28)

Background
----------

Further information: [Battle of Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Battle_of_Beit_Hanoun "Battle of Beit Hanoun")
 and [Battle of Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")

Fighting between Palestinian militants and the IDF had taken place in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")
 and Jabalia since 27 October 2023 and 8 November 2023, respectively.[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 The IDF also launched raids into [Beit Lahia](/wiki/Beit_Lahia "Beit Lahia")
 such as the [Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
 in December 2024 and May 2024.[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)
[\[31\]](#cite_note-31)
[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)

The IDF encountered "significant resistance" during the [fighting in Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 and ultimately failed to dismantle Hamas' presence in the city.[\[33\]](#cite_note-:6-33)

On 31 May 2024, the IDF withdrew from North Gaza, including both Beit Hanoun and Jabalia.[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)
[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)

In the four months since the Israeli withdrawal, Hamas reportedly reconstituted itself in Jabalia and managed to recruit thousands of new fighters in the area.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 Hamas also planted explosives in almost all buildings in Jabalia, sometimes even causing the death of its own militants.[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)

Siege
-----

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg/250px-Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)](/wiki/File:Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)

Israeli soldiers inspecting a [Merkava](/wiki/Merkava "Merkava")
 that was destroyed by Hamas in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")

### Jabalia

On the evening of 5 October,[\[4\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification1-4)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification2-5)
 the IDF began its stated operation to dismantle Hamas control in Jabalia, with the [Israeli Air Force](/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force "Israeli Air Force")
 launching strikes around the area while armored brigades encircled the [Jabalia refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)

The IDF advanced into Jabalia and were met by combined attacks from Hamas, [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
 (PIJ), [al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades](/wiki/Al-Aqsa_Martyrs%27_Brigades "Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades")
, and the [Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine](/wiki/Popular_Front_for_the_Liberation_of_Palestine "Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine")
 (PFLP).[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 PIJ launched an attack on an Israeli [command and control room](/wiki/Command_center "Command center")
 belonging to forces attempting to penetrate the Jabalia refugee camp.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)

On 10 October, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)
[\[39\]](#cite_note-39)
[\[40\]](#cite_note-40)
 The IDF said that an Israeli airstrike on a Hamas command and control centre killed at least 12 Hamas and PIJ commanders.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)

On 13 October, Israeli prime minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 stated that the IDF had reached "the heart of Jabalia" and were dismantling Hamas strongholds there. He is considered to have been the highest-ranking officer to have died in ground combat since the start of the Gaza war.[\[45\]](#cite_note-45)
[\[46\]](#cite_note-46)

On 22 October, Hamas said that its fighters detonated an explosive device targeting 12 Israeli soldiers in the Jabalia refugee camp, killing and wounding some of them.[\[47\]](#cite_note-47)

On 17 November, Israeli media reported that that IDF soldiers preparing an ambush in southern Jabalia were themselves ambushed by Hamas fighters.[\[48\]](#cite_note-48)

On 20 December, a Hamas fighter carried out a suicide bombing against an IDF position in the Jabalia camp.[\[49\]](#cite_note-49)

On 30 December, Palestinian militants carried out a "relatively large attack" in multiple waves against IDF positions around the Jabalia camp.[\[50\]](#cite_note-50)

### Beit Lahia

On 11 October, clashes between the IDF and Hamas were reported to be taking place in Beit Lahia.[\[51\]](#cite_note-51)
 Palestinian health officials stated on 27 October that Israeli strikes had killed at least 87 people.[\[52\]](#cite_note-52)
 On 28 October, an Israeli attack on the Beit Lahia residential square reportedly killed 45 people, with more than 30 trapped under the rubble.[\[53\]](#cite_note-53)
 After residents of Jabalia fled to Beit Lahia, the IDF then reportedly turned their attention to the town.[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)
 Sam Rose, a UN official, stated, "People who fled to Beit Lahiya have themselves been bombed".[\[55\]](#cite_note-55)
 Beit Lahia declared a state of emergency due to Israel's siege and attacks, stating, "We declare that the city is a disaster area due to the Israeli war of extermination and siege, and it has no food, water, hospitals, doctors, services, or communications".[\[56\]](#cite_note-56)

Five people were reportedly killed by Israeli airstrikes in Beit Lahia on 1 November.[\[57\]](#cite_note-57)
 Rescue teams were also attacked, with three members hit by a drone, while the civil defence stated an Israeli tank destroyed their only fire truck.[\[58\]](#cite_note-58)
 At least twenty people were reportedly killed during an attack on 4 November, with video showing residents pulling bodies out of the rubble.[\[59\]](#cite_note-59)

On 23 December, Hamas said that some of its fighters stormed an IDF position at a building in Beit Lahia and managed to free several Palestinians who had been detained inside.[\[60\]](#cite_note-60)

### Beit Hanoun

In Beit Hanoun, the IDF conducted bombings on the night of 11–12 November and targeted fleeing civilians with drones and sniper fire the next day.[\[61\]](#cite_note-61)
 The IDF besieged some 130 families in a shelter in the city and forced them to leave at gunpoint.[\[62\]](#cite_note-62)

Despite claiming to have “dismantled Hamas” in Beit Hanoun, Israeli forces who entered the abandoned city on 23 December were immediately ambushed by militants. We can’t get out."[\[80\]](#cite_note-80)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/NetzarimCorridor.jpg/330px-NetzarimCorridor.jpg)](/wiki/File:NetzarimCorridor.jpg)

Approximate location of the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
.

According to Israeli media, tens of thousands of Palestinians have passed through the IDF security crossing at the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
 to get to the southern Gaza Strip.[\[41\]](#cite_note-:3-41)
 On 7 October 2024, however, UN Spokesperson [Stéphane Dujarric](/wiki/St%C3%A9phane_Dujarric "Stéphane Dujarric")
 stated many people in northern Gaza were "trapped" in their homes and that "few families have crossed Wadi Gaza heading South".[\[81\]](#cite_note-81)
 [Doctors Without Borders](/wiki/Doctors_Without_Borders "Doctors Without Borders")
 stated at least five of their staff members were trapped in Jabalia, stating, "Nobody is allowed to get in or out; anyone who tries is getting shot".[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 head [Philippe Lazzarini](/wiki/Philippe_Lazzarini "Philippe Lazzarini")
 stated, "People attempting to flee are getting killed, their bodies left on the street".[\[82\]](#cite_note-82)

Anas al-Sharif, a journalist on the ground, stated that possibly thousands of families were "trapped between tanks, their gunfire, and heavy artillery shelling".[\[83\]](#cite_note-83)
 One woman stated she was forced from her home "at gunpoint" as tanks and heavily armed soldiers encircled her family, and that young men were separated for interrogation.[\[84\]](#cite_note-84)
 Another woman stated that in Jabalia, a quadcopter told residents: "Don't think of north Gaza ever again."[\[85\]](#cite_note-Under_deadly_Israeli_siege-85)
 Israeli footage showed men separated at checkpoints in northern Gaza and possibly detained.[\[86\]](#cite_note-86)
 The Israeli military released footage of Palestinians being rounded up near the besieged Indonesia Hospital, where they had been sheltering.[\[87\]](#cite_note-87)
[\[88\]](#cite_note-88)
 Residents stated Israeli forced stormed shelters for displaced families and detained men, with footage showing men sitting next to a tank while others were led away by a soldier.[\[89\]](#cite_note-89)
 The UN Human Rights Office stated it was concerned the men could be subject to arbitrary detainment and torture.[\[90\]](#cite_note-90)

### Targeting of civilians

Per the [Palestinian Civil Defense](/wiki/Palestinian_Civil_Defence "Palestinian Civil Defence")
, at least 17 people, including 9 children, were killed in the IDF's initial wave of airstrikes.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)
 One of those killed was journalist Hassan Hamad, who was reportedly deliberately targeted by Israel after receiving threats via messages and calls from Israeli officers, ordering him to stop his reporting.[\[91\]](#cite_note-91)
 After an Israeli airstrike on 11 October that killed at least 22 Palestinians and wounded more than 90, Hamas made a statement the following day condemning what it described as the "[Nazi](/wiki/Nazism "Nazism")
 occupation’s massacres" in Jabalia under [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")
 protection.[\[92\]](#cite_note-92)
 Journalists stated they were being directly targeted by the Israeli army, including Fadi Al Wahidi, who was reportedly shot in the neck by a sniper.[\[93\]](#cite_note-93)

On 14 October, [Al Jazeera Arabic](/wiki/Al_Jazeera_Arabic "Al Jazeera Arabic")
 reported the Israeli military was planting explosives in homes to demolish them.[\[94\]](#cite_note-94)
 The same day, medics reported that Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for flour at a food distribution centre, killing ten people and wounding dozens.[\[95\]](#cite_note-95)
 On 16 October, the Gaza Civil Defense stated there were dozens of people trapped under the rubble, and some bodies were laying in the road unable to be rescued.[\[96\]](#cite_note-96)
 Gaza's civil defence agency spokesman stated, "There are a number of pleas from families being bombed inside Jabalia camp... stated Israel had "failed to implement" their recommendations, and that it would "follow the law" if Israel did not comply by its deadline.[\[135\]](#cite_note-135)

### Hospitals and healthcare

During the siege, the Health Ministry stated Israel was "intensifying its targeting of the health system in the northern Gaza Strip".[\[103\]](#cite_note-Israeli_air_strike_kills_33-103)
 WHO's vaccination campaign to address Gaza's [polio epidemic](/wiki/2024_Gaza_Strip_polio_epidemic "2024 Gaza Strip polio epidemic")
 was delayed in northern Gaza due to the escalating violence and intense bombing.[\[136\]](#cite_note-136)
 On 9 October, an Israeli airstrike killed at least 15 people inside Al-Yemen Al-Saeed Hospital in Jabalia, which has housed displaced families.[\[137\]](#cite_note-137)
 Israel reportedly used a "double tap" bombing, injuring fifteen people in a family home, then targeted an ambulance arriving to help them, killing a doctor.[\[138\]](#cite_note-138)

The Gaza Health Ministry stated Israel had besieged and was directly targeting the [Indonesia Hospital](/wiki/Indonesia_Hospital "Indonesia Hospital")
, Kamal Adwan Hospital, and [Al-Awda Hospital](/wiki/Al-Awda_Hospital "Al-Awda Hospital")
.[\[139\]](#cite_note-139)
 More than 350 patients were reportedly trapped in the three hospitals, including pregnant women, people with chronic health conditions, and individuals needing surgeries.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)
 The Al Awda hospital stated Israeli strikes on the hospital and an ambulance had wounded several medical staff.[\[140\]](#cite_note-140)
 In a statement, the director of Al-Awda Hospital stated, "Israeli forces are targeting everything that moves in northern Gaza".[\[141\]](#cite_note-141)

#### Indonesia Hospital

The Indonesia Hospital's director stated, "Israeli tanks have completely surrounded the hospital, cut off electricity and shelled the hospital, targeting the second and third floors with artillery".[\[142\]](#cite_note-142)
 Staff reported heavy gunfire directed at the hospital, with more than 40 patients injured.[\[143\]](#cite_note-143)
 Two patients at Indonesia Hospital were reported to have died after the hospital lost electricity, as the UN stated the Indonesia Hospital was no longer operational.[\[144\]](#cite_note-144)
[\[145\]](#cite_note-145)
 Indonesia Hospital's chief nurse stated the hospital's water supply had been cut, that operating the electric generator required permission from the IDF, and there was no food available for four consecutive days.[\[146\]](#cite_note-146)
 On 21 October 2024, medics at Indonesia Hospital stated Israeli forces set a nearby school on fire, which spread to the hospital and shut down its power.[\[147\]](#cite_note-147)

#### Kamal Adwan Hospital

On 25 October 2024, Israel launched [a raid of Kamal Adwan Hospital](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges#October_and_November_2024 "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
.[\[148\]](#cite_note-148)
 The Palestinian health ministry stated 600 patients, companions, and staff were trapped.[\[149\]](#cite_note-149)
 The following day, the [World Health Organization](/wiki/World_Health_Organization "World Health Organization")
 stated that while the hospital was still under siege, it had regained contact with its employees there, stating that four employees were injured, 44 health workers had been detained, and four ambulances were damaged.[\[150\]](#cite_note-150)
 The Gaza Ministry of Health stated that Israeli forces had detained all male medical staff.[\[151\]](#cite_note-151)
 On 27 October, Dr. Israel](/wiki/South_Africa%27s_genocide_case_against_Israel "South Africa's genocide case against Israel")<br>        *   [Gaza genocide](/wiki/Gaza_genocide "Gaza genocide")<br>            <br>    *   [ICC arrest warrants](/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_arrest_warrants_for_Israeli_leaders "International Criminal Court arrest warrants for Israeli leaders")<br>        <br>* Evacuation and attacks on civilians
-----------------------------------

### Generals' plan

Main article: [Israeli generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")

On 6 October 2024, Israel designated all of the northern Gaza Strip as a combat zone and ordered the entire civilian population to evacuate.[\[71\]](#cite_note-71)
[\[72\]](#cite_note-72)
 Both Israeli military analysts and the [Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights](/wiki/Al-Mezan_Center_for_Human_Rights "Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights")
 alleged that this was the first stage of the "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
", a policy proposed by former Israeli general [Giora Eiland](/wiki/Giora_Eiland "Giora Eiland")
 to force Palestinians out of Gaza on pain of death.[\[73\]](#cite_note-73)
 The Israeli human rights organizations [Gisha](/wiki/Gisha_(human_rights_organization) "Gisha (human rights organization)")
, [B'Tselem](/wiki/B%27Tselem "B'Tselem")
, [Physicians for Human Rights](/wiki/Physicians_for_Human_Rights%E2%80%93Israel "Physicians for Human Rights–Israel")
 and [Yesh Din](/wiki/Yesh_Din "Yesh Din")
 stated there were "alarming signs" that Israel was implementing the plan.[\[74\]](#cite_note-74)
 Three Israeli reserve soldiers in Gaza stated it was their understanding the general's plan was being practically implemented.[\[75\]](#cite_note-75)
 The plan has been described by Hamas as [genocidal](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")
.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 Others have described the plan as the [ethnic cleansing](/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing "Ethnic cleansing")
 of northern Gaza.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
 The United Nations warned that Israel was not allowing food to enter northern Gaza or Jabalia.[\[76\]](#cite_note-76)
[\[77\]](#cite_note-77)

On 7 October, the IDF issued evacuation orders for residents of Jabalia, Beit Hanoun, and Beit Lahia, instructing them to travel southwards to the [al-Mawasi humanitarian zone](/wiki/Al-Mawasi,_Rafah "Al-Mawasi, Rafah")
.[\[78\]](#cite_note-78)
 Following these evacuation orders was made more difficult by Israel's ongoing bombardment, as well as drones pursuing and shooting at individuals attempting to flee.[\[79\]](#cite_note-79)
 Residents reported being trapped in Jabalia, with all roads blocked except the main highway leading out. Then, they stormed the area with their tanks and opened fire randomly."[\[105\]](#cite_note-105)
 At least 87 people were killed by an [airstrike in Beit Lahia](/wiki/October_2024_Beit_Lahia_attacks "October 2024 Beit Lahia attacks")
.[\[106\]](#cite_note-106)

On 21 October, 10 people were reportedly killed and 30 wounded by an Israeli attack at the Jabalia Preparatory School turned shelter.[\[107\]](#cite_note-107)
 A paramedic fleeing the shelter stated that people were attempting to comply with an evacuation order when "suddenly there was shelling".[\[108\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[109\]](#cite_note-109)
 On 23 October, civil defence teams stated they were attempting to rescue people buried under rubble by hand.[\[110\]](#cite_note-110)
 The same day, three civil defense workers were wounded in a "targeted strike" by Israel, leading the agency to suspend operations in northern Gaza.[\[111\]](#cite_note-111)
 Israeli forces also reportedly killed northern Gaza's chief of police.[\[112\]](#cite_note-112)
 The civil defense reported 150 people were killed and injured in an airstrike on Jabalia's Block 7 on 24 October.[\[113\]](#cite_note-113)
 Dozens were killed by Israeli strikes on residences in Beit Lahia on 26 October.[\[114\]](#cite_note-114)
 As many as 93 people were killed by an [Israeli airstrike on Beit Lahia](/wiki/29_October_2024_Beit_Lahia_strike "29 October 2024 Beit Lahia strike")
 on 29 October.[\[115\]](#cite_note-115)

On 1 November 2024, the Gaza Government Media Office reported two Israeli airstrikes on residential buildings killed 84 people, including 50 children.[\[116\]](#cite_note-116)
 The civil defense stated they were unable to reach the site and residents were attempting rescues.[\[117\]](#cite_note-117)
 Women evacuating from Jabalia stated the Israeli army forced them into holes, where dust was thrown on them as an intimidation tactic.[\[118\]](#cite_note-118)

Dr. Retrieved 2025-01-22.

Retrieved from "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Siege\_of\_North\_Gaza&oldid=1306732167](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_North_Gaza&oldid=1306732167)
"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters, with the location being the North Gaza Governorate and the Gaza Strip. The article details the events in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun, including the attacks on civilians, hospitals, and healthcare facilities. The article also mentions the "generals' plan" to force Palestinians out of northern Gaza. The article states that on October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")
image_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia Gaza")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/6/israel-launches-ground-offensive-on-jabalia-again-killing-17): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article on October 6, 2024, reporting on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia, resulting in at least 17 deaths. <image:1> The article mentions intense bombardment, tank deployment, and evacuation orders. The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia.


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/dec/18/jabaliya-refugee-camp-gaza-destruction-idf): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on December 18, 2024, discussing the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces. The article mentions three offensives, with the third one starting on October 5, 2024. The article includes satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp. <image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>. The article also mentions that the IDF said it was targeting military objectives.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_North_Gaza): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters, with the location being the North Gaza Governorate and the Gaza Strip. The article details the events in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun, including the attacks on civilians, hospitals, and healthcare facilities. The article also mentions the "generals' plan" to force Palestinians out of northern Gaza. The article states that on October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The Guardian discussed the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces, with the third offensive starting on October 5, 2024, and included satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>).

Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.

## Web Sources

PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")
image_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The Guardian discussed the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces, with the third offensive starting on October 5, 2024, and included satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>).

Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera reports on battles in northern Gaza, mentioning Palestinian fighters ambushing Israeli troops (<image:6423>). PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. Specifically, Wikipedia mentions an ambush by Hamas on October 10, 2024, which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company east of the Jabalia camp. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event.

Therefore, while the claim's context is supported by the evidence, the image's specific association with the ambush cannot be verified. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")

```

Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera reports on battles in northern Gaza, mentioning Palestinian fighters ambushing Israeli troops (<image:6423>). PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. Specifically, Wikipedia mentions an ambush by Hamas on October 10, 2024, which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company east of the Jabalia camp. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event.

Therefore, while the claim's context is supported by the evidence, the image's specific association with the ambush cannot be verified. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Israel declares ‘state of war’ after Hamas militants launch surprise attack from Gaza (videos)
==============================================================================================

Posted by [MC](https://9jaflaver.com/author/mc/ "Posts by MC")
 on October 7, 2023,

  

SportyBet Ad

  

  [![Chat with Travel Loan Agent](https://9jaflaver.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/japa_funds.jpg )](https://api.whatsapp.com/send?phone=+2347051778167&text=Hello%20Travel%20Loan%20Agent)

  

Check Out More Premium Beats, Click Here

Israel declares ‘state of war’ after Hamas militants launch surprise attack from Gaza (videos)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

! <image:4201>

  

[! <image:4202>](https://t84c3srgclc9.com/w770sv6vyk?key=b49f393b8f652f3142faa49e81ac352e)

  

Palestinian Islamist group, Hamas launched the biggest attack on Israel  on Saturday morning, October 7 in a surprise assault as several gunmen crossed into different Israeli towns while a heavy barrage of rockets are fired from the Gaza Strip.

As at press time, warning sirens sounded across southern and central Israel, including in Jerusalem.

At least 40 people have been killed since Hamas launched the surprise attack on Israel, the country’s emergency service said.

Another 779 people have been wounded, according to the Israeli Health Ministry.

  
Israel’s military said it was on a war footing and the defense minister said the Iran-backed Hamas had made a “grave mistake” by declaring war on Israel, in retaliation, Israeli military launched air strikes into Gaza.

  
Israeli Defense Minister Gallant said Hamas had “launched a war against the State of Israel”. Israeli “troops are fighting against the enemy at every location”, he said.

![Israel declares ](https://alexis.lindaikejisblog.com/photos/shares/107313160-1696661234669-gettyimages-1711150149-20090101231007-911-002189_1696674381.jpeg)

  
The Israeli military said its forces were operating inside Gaza but gave no details.

> “A number of terrorists have infiltrated into Israeli territory from the Gaza Strip,” the military said in a statement, adding that residents in the area surrounding the Gaza Strip had been told to stay in their homes.

The attack marked an unprecedented infiltration by an unknown number of Hamas gunmen into Israel from Gaza, and one of the most serious escalations in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict in decades.

Israeli media reported gunbattles between bands of Palestinian fighters and security forces in towns in southern Israel. Israel’s police chief said there were “21 active scenes” in southern Israel.

  
In Gaza, people rushed to buy supplies in anticipation of days of war ahead. Some evacuated their homes and headed for shelters.

  
Hamas military commander, Mohammad Deif announced the start of the operation in a broadcast on Hamas media, calling on Palestinians everywhere to fight.

![Israel declares ](https://alexis.lindaikejisblog.com/photos/shares/107313161-1696664544161-gettyimages-1711245488-AFP_33XP63Y_1696674371.jpeg)

  
“This is the day of the greatest battle to end the last occupation on earth,” he said, adding that 5,000 rockets had been launched.

Speaking to Israel N12 News by phone from a Nir Oz, a kibbutz near Gaza, a woman identified as Dorin said militants had infiltrated her house and tried to open the bomb shelter where she was hiding.

>   
> “They just came in again, please send help,” she said. “There are a lot of homes harmed … My husband is holding the door closed … They are firing rounds of bullets.”

Palestinian media reported that a number of Israelis had been taken captive by fighters and Hamas media circulated video footage apparently showing a destroyed Israeli tank.

  
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in  a speech this morning said the country was in war. His office said he would meet top security officials in the coming hours.

  
The Palestinian Islamic Jihad group said its fighters were joining Hamas in the attack.

  
“We are part of this battle, our fighters are side-by-side with their brothers in the Qassam Brigades until victory is achieved,” said Islamic Jihad armed wing spokesman Abu Hamza on a post on Telegram.

  
The attack came a day after Israel marked the 50th anniversary of the 1973 war that brought the country to the verge of catastrophic defeat in a surprise attack by Syria and Egypt.

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740638_img20231007063148_jpeg0756aad4954d77978ecd178fbbf6930c)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740639_screenmaster20231007063416_jpeg8a2723256f4e323049af97dfa8770b6f)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740640_img20231007064058_jpeg7dcde991e6026c7a8397b6e3a5f2cf93)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740641_img20231007064203_jpeg6ab49057eb636386ec9a67b195b39b00)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740643_img20231007064211_jpegf75873dc3901cd30ae186a01944ed230)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740644_img20231007064207_jpeg6f3770bca1886faa14defa6a03784302)

![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/17740645_img20231007064209_jpeg8e6b74e3543209f35a1bfd44b8dbd496)

see videos below:

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from 9jaflaver.com, published on October 7, 2023, discusses the surprise attack by Hamas on Israel. The article includes images of the aftermath of the attacks, including destroyed vehicles and buildings <image:4201>. The article also mentions that Hamas launched a surprise attack on October 7, 2023, and that Israel declared a state of war. The article includes a video of a destroyed Israeli tank. The article also includes several advertisements.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")
image_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The Guardian discussed the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces, with the third offensive starting on October 5, 2024, and included satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>).

Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera reports on battles in northern Gaza, mentioning Palestinian fighters ambushing Israeli troops (<image:6423>). PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. Specifically, Wikipedia mentions an ambush by Hamas on October 10, 2024, which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company east of the Jabalia camp. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event.

Therefore, while the claim's context is supported by the evidence, the image's specific association with the ambush cannot be verified. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.


## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:34>)
```

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image appears on Nairaland, a Nigerian forum, in a thread discussing the October 7, 2023, Hamas attacks on Israel. The thread, created on October 7, 2023, includes reports from various news sources about the attacks and Israel's declaration of war readiness. The image is included in a post from October 7, 2023.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")
image_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The Guardian discussed the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces, with the third offensive starting on October 5, 2024, and included satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>).

Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera reports on battles in northern Gaza, mentioning Palestinian fighters ambushing Israeli troops (<image:6423>). PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. Specifically, Wikipedia mentions an ambush by Hamas on October 10, 2024, which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company east of the Jabalia camp. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event.

Therefore, while the claim's context is supported by the evidence, the image's specific association with the ambush cannot be verified. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.


## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:34>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6/%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6-%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6/209455-%E0%A6%AE%E0%A7%81%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%A6%E0%A7%80%E0%A6%A8-%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%89%E0%A6%9C-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AF-%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%AB%E0%A6%B0-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AA%E0%A7%AA%E0%A7%AD-%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%B0%E0%A7%80-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AA-%E0%A6%86%E0%A6%97%E0%A6%B8%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%9F-%E0%A7%A8%E0%A7%A6%E0%A7%A8%E0%A7%AB-%E0%A6%88%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%BE%E0%A7%9F%E0%A7%80%E2%80%8B%E2%80%8B): Found exact image on website with title: মুজাহিদীন নিউজ || ১৯ সফর, ১৪৪৭ হিজরী || ১৪ আগস্ট, ২০২৫ ঈসায়ী

    [#1](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/সংবাদ/জিহাদ-সংবাদ/209455-মুজাহিদীন-নিউজ-১৯-সফর-১৪৪৭-হিজরী-১৪-আগস্ট-২০২৫-ঈসায়ী​​#post209455)
    
    মুজাহিদীন নিউজ || ১৯ সফর, ১৪৪৭ হিজরী || ১৪ আগস্ট, ২০২৫ ঈসায়ী​​
    --------------------------------------------------------------
    
    1 week ago
    
    **আল-কাসসামের সফল অপারেশন: খান ইউনিসে ইহুদিবাদী দখলদারদের দুটি ট্যাংক ধ্বংস**
    
    ! <image:4221>
    
      
      
      
      
    ইহুদিবাদী দখলদার ইসরায়েলের নৃশংসতা ও অত্যাচারের বিরুদ্ধে ফিলিস্তিনি মুজাহিদদের সংগ্রাম অব্যাহত রয়েছে। আল-কাসসাম ব্রিগেডস তাদের সর্বশেষ অপারেশনে ইসরায়েলি দখলদার বাহিনীর দুটি মেরকাভা ট্যাংক ধ্বংস করেছে। খান ইউনিসের আবু হামিদ এলাকায় সংঘটিত এই অপারেশনে ইয়াসিন-১০৫ শেল ও সাইড আইইডি ব্যবহার করে ইহুদিবাদী সন্ত্রাসীদের উপর কঠোর প্রতিশোধ নেওয়া হয়েছে।  
      
    আল-কাসসাম ব্রিগেডস ১৪ আগস্ট, বৃহস্পতিবার এক বিবৃতিতে জানিয়েছে যে তাদের যোদ্ধারা কেন্দ্রীয় খান ইউনিসের আবু হামিদ এলাকায় ইহুদিবাদী দখলদার বাহিনীর দুটি মেরকাভা ট্যাংক লক্ষ্য করে দুটি ইয়াসিন-১০৫ শেল ও একটি সাইড আইইডি’র বিস্ফোরণ ঘটিয়ে সেগুলো সফলভাবে ধ্বংস করেছে। এই অপারেশনটি গাজা উপত্যকায় ইসরায়েলের অব্যাহত গণহত্যা, ধ্বংসযজ্ঞ ও মানবতাবিরোধী অপরাধের জবাব হিসেবে পরিচালিত হয়েছে।  
      
    ইসরায়েলি দখলদার বাহিনী ২০২৩ সাল থেকে গাজায় নৃশংস হামলা চালাচ্ছে। আন্তর্জাতিক আদালতের রায় উপেক্ষা করে ইহুদিবাদী সন্ত্রাসীরা গাজায় অবরোধ দিয়ে, খাদ্য ও ওষুধের সংকট সৃষ্টি করে মানবিক বিপর্যয় ডেকে এনেছে। এমনকি বিশ্ব স্বাস্থ্য সংস্থা (WHO) ও জাতিসংঘ বারবার সতর্ক করেও ইসরায়েলের নৃশংসতা বন্ধ করতে পারেনি।  
      
    এই পরিস্থিতিতে আল-কাসসাম ব্রিগেডসের মতো ফিলিস্তিনি প্রতিরোধ গ্রুপগুলোর অপারেশন ইহুদিবাদী দখলদারদের জন্য ক্রমাগত চ্যালেঞ্জ হয়ে দাঁড়িয়েছে। গত জুলাই মাসেও আল-কাসসাম ও আল-কুদস ব্রিগেডস যৌথভাবে ইসরায়েলি সেনাদের ওপর মর্টার হামলা চালিয়ে যানবাহন ধ্বংস করেছিল।  
      
    ইসরায়েলি দখলদার বাহিনীর নৃশংসতা যতই বাড়ছে, ফিলিস্তিনি জনগণের প্রতিরোধের চেতনা ততই শাণিত হচ্ছে। আল-কাসসাম ব্রিগেডসের ১৪ আগস্ট, বৃহস্পতিবারের সফল অপারেশন প্রমাণ করে যে, অন্যায়ের বিরুদ্ধে সংগ্রাম কখনই থামানো যায় না। ইসরায়েলের অভ্যন্তরে বেড়ে চলেছে হতাশা নেতৃত্বহীনতার অভিযোগ। যুদ্ধের সময় যত গড়াচ্ছে, ততই স্পষ্ট হয়ে উঠছে—যারা একদিন দখল নিতে এসেছিল, তারা আজ নিজেরাই দিশেহারা।
    
    * * *
    
      
    তথ্যসূত্র:  
    1\. Al-Qassam Brigades: we targeted two Zionist Merkava tanks with two Yassin-105 shells and a side IED near Abu Hamid roundabout in central Khan Younis, southern Gaza.  
    – [https://tinyurl.com/bdea4r3j](https://tinyurl.com/bdea4r3j)

    * * *
    
    [#2](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/সংবাদ/জিহাদ-সংবাদ/209455-মুজাহিদীন-নিউজ-১৯-সফর-১৪৪৭-হিজরী-১৪-আগস্ট-২০২৫-ঈসায়ী​​?p=209457#post209457)
    
    1 week ago
    
    **কিরগিজস্তানের সাথে যুগান্তকারী বাণিজ্য সহযোগিতা চুক্তি স্বাক্ষর করেছে ইমারতে ইসলামিয়া**
    
    ! <image:4223>
    
      
      
    দ্বিপক্ষীয় অর্থনৈতিক সম্পর্ক জোরদার করতে কিরগিজস্তানের সাথে একটি ব্যাপক অর্থনৈতিক পদক্ষেপ হাতে নিয়েছে ইমারতে ইসলামিয়া আফগানিস্তান। এই উদ্দেশ্যে একটি বিস্তারিত রোডম্যাপ প্রণয়ন ও সমঝোতা চুক্তি স্বাক্ষর করেছে উভয় পক্ষ। সম্প্রতি ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার শিল্প ও বাণিজ্য মন্ত্রী নূরুদ্দিন আজিজি হাফিযাহুল্লাহ’র কিরগিজস্তান সফরকালে এই চুক্তি স্বাক্ষরিত হয়েছে।  
      
    এই সময় বাণিজ্য সম্পর্ক সম্প্রসারণ ও ব্যবসায় বাধা অপসারণ করতে কিরগিজ প্রতিনিধিদের সাথে ব্যাপক আলোচনা উপস্থাপিত হয়েছে।  
      
    এছাড়া যৌথ বাণিজ্য কাউন্সিল গঠন, নিয়মিত বৈঠক আয়োজন এবং অগ্রগতি পর্যবেক্ষণের জন্য একটি যৌথ ওয়ার্কিং গ্রুপ গঠনের বিষয়ে উক্ত সভায় আলোচনা হয়েছে।  
      
    ট্রেড হাউস ও বাণিজ্যিক কেন্দ্র চালু করা, অর্থনৈতিক ফোরাম, প্রদর্শনী এবং আফগানিস্তানে যৌথ বিনিয়োগ সম্প্রসারণের পরিকল্পনা উত্থাপিত হয়েছে।  
      
    দ্বিপাক্ষিক ট্রানজিট করিডোর, বাণিজ্য ও ট্রানজিট উন্নয়ন চুক্তি স্বাক্ষর এবং উজবেকিস্তান ও তাজিকিস্তানকে জড়িত করে ত্রিপক্ষীয় সহযোগিতায় কাজ করতে উভয়ে সম্মত হয়েছে।  
      
    নতুন এই চুক্তিতে কিরগিজ প্রশাসনের পক্ষ থেকে আফগান ব্যবসায়ীদের বাণিজ্যিক ভিসা, ব্যাংকিং সংযোগ ও পরিবহন রুট সহজতর করার প্রতিশ্রুতি রয়েছে।  
      
    আফগানিস্তান দক্ষিণ এশিয়া, মধ্য এশিয়া এবং মধ্য প্রাচ্যকে সংযোগকারী ট্রানজিট হাব হয়ে উঠার প্রবল সম্ভাবনা রয়েছে। তাই কৌশলগত অবস্থানকে কাজে লাগিয়ে মধ্য এশিয়ার রাষ্ট্রগুলোতে বাণিজ্য সম্প্রসারণ করছে ইমারতে ইসলামিয়া।  
      
    উক্ত সমঝোতা স্মারক দ্বিপক্ষীয় সম্পর্কের ক্ষেত্রে একটি উল্লেখযোগ্য মাইলফলক হিসেবে অভিহিত করেছেন উভয় পক্ষ। এর মাধ্যমে উভয় দেশের মধ্যে ব্যবসা বৃদ্ধি ও অর্থনৈতিক সংহতির পথ প্রশস্ত হবে বলে প্রত্যাশা করা হচ্ছে।
    
    * * *
    
      
    তথ্যসূত্র:  
    1\. Afghanistan and Kyrgyzstan sign landmark economic and Trade Cooperation Agreement  
    \-https://tinyurl.com/4nytpvbe

    [#3](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/সংবাদ/জিহাদ-সংবাদ/209455-মুজাহিদীন-নিউজ-১৯-সফর-১৪৪৭-হিজরী-১৪-আগস্ট-২০২৫-ঈসায়ী​​?p=209458#post209458)
    
    1 week ago
    
    **আমেরিকার প্রচারিত মানবাধিকার প্রতিবেদনে রাজনৈতিক সুর বিদ্যমান: জাবিহুল্লাহ মুজাহিদ হাফিযাহুল্লাহ**
    
    ! <image:4228>
    
      
      
    ইমারতে ইসলামিয়া আফগানিস্তানে যুক্তরাষ্ট্রের সরাসরি উপস্থিতি নেই, তারা আফগানিস্তান সম্পর্কে প্রত্যক্ষ জ্ঞানও রাখে না, তা সত্ত্বেও মানবাধিকার ইস্যুতে নিজেদের ইচ্ছে মতো মূল্যায়ন প্রকাশ করে যাচ্ছে ওয়াশিংটন। মার্কিন পররাষ্ট্র দপ্তরের মানবাধিকার বিষয়ক বার্ষিক প্রতিবেদনের প্রতিক্রিয়ায় এসব মন্তব্য করেন ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার মুখপাত্র জাবিহুল্লাহ মুজাহিদ হাফিযাহুল্লাহ।  
      
    উক্ত মানবাধিকার প্রতিবেদনে দাবি করা হয়, তালিবান সরকারের অধীনে আফগানিস্তানে মানবাধিকার সুরক্ষা উল্লেখযোগ্যভাবে হ্রাস পেয়েছে। নারী অধিকার ও মত প্রকাশের স্বাধীনতা লঙ্ঘিত হয়েছে।  
      
    জবাবে মুজাহিদ হাফিযাহুল্লাহ বলেন, আফগানিস্তানে কোনও মার্কিন দূতাবাস নেই। তাই তাদের পক্ষে আফগানিস্তানের বাস্তবতা, অগ্রগতি বা মানবাধিকারের বিষয়গুলো পর্যবেক্ষণ করা চলে না। এই প্রতিবেদনগুলোর সাথে রাজনৈতিক উদ্দেশ্য জড়িত, অধিকাংশ প্রতিবেদন ষড়যন্ত্রের হাতিয়ার হিসেবে প্রকাশ করা হয়ে থাকে।  
      
    তিনি জোর দিয়ে বলেন, যুক্তরাষ্ট্রের উচিত মার্কিন দখলদারিত্বের সময়ের সাথে আফগানিস্তানের বর্তমান পরিস্থিতি তুলনা করা, মানবাধিকার সুরক্ষার ক্ষেত্রে কোন সময়কালটি অধিক উত্তম সেটা তারা অনুধাবন করুক।  
      
    তিনি আরও বলেন, আফগান ইস্যু নিয়ে আমেরিকার উদ্বিগ্ন হওয়া উচিত নয়, কেননা নাগরিকদের অধিকার সম্পর্কে বর্তমান সরকার অবগত আছে। আফগানিস্তানের একটি একটি ধর্মীয় ও আইনি দৃষ্টিভঙ্গি রয়েছে, নাগরিকদের অধিকার নিশ্চিত করতে এখানে ধর্মীয় বাধ্যবাধকতা রয়েছে।
    
    * * *
    
    তথ্যসূত্র:  
    1\. US human rights report on Afghanistan has a ‘political tone’, says IEA spokesman  
    – [https://tinyurl.com/3m7bzhc9](https://tinyurl.com/3m7bzhc9)

    [#4](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/সংবাদ/জিহাদ-সংবাদ/209455-মুজাহিদীন-নিউজ-১৯-সফর-১৪৪৭-হিজরী-১৪-আগস্ট-২০২৫-ঈসায়ী​​?p=209459#post209459)
    
    1 week ago
    
    **ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার চার বছরের অর্জন: সামরিক ও রাজনৈতিক দু’ক্ষেত্রেই বিজয়**
    
    ! <image:4231>
    
      
      
      
    আফগানিস্তানে ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার শাসন পুনঃপ্রতিষ্ঠার চার বছর পূর্ণ হতে চলেছে। এ উপলক্ষে ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার কর্মকর্তারা সামরিক ও রাজনৈতিক ক্ষেত্রে নিজেদের অর্জনের ওপর আলোকপাত করেছেন।  
      
    গত ১৩ আগস্ট কাতারে অবস্থিত ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার দূতাবাসের ভারপ্রাপ্ত প্রধান সুহাইল শাহিন হাফিযাহুল্লাহ জানান, ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার বিজয় অর্জনের ফলে শত্রুদের রাজনৈতিক ও কৌশলগত পরিকল্পনা ব্যর্থ হয়েছে এবং দেশের প্রশাসনিক কাঠামো আরও মজবুত হয়েছে।  
      
    তিনি বলেন, ‘এই বিজয়ের গুরুত্বপূর্ণ দিক হলো ইমারতে ইসলামিয়া শুধু সামরিক নয়, রাজনৈতিক ক্ষেত্রেও সফলতা অর্জন করেছে। এই উদ্যোগ আফগানিস্তানে ইসলামি শাসন প্রতিষ্ঠার পথকে সুগম করেছে।’  
      
    তিনি আরও বলেন, ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার সদস্যদের প্রচেষ্টা ও আফগান জনগণের ত্যাগের কারণে বিশ্ব শক্তি ও তাদের মিত্ররা পরাজিত হয়েছে।  
      
    এর আগে, ইমারতে ইসলামিয়ার জ্যেষ্ঠ নেতা আনাস হাক্কানি হাফিযাহুল্লাহ দোহা চুক্তিকে আফগানিস্তানে আমেরিকার পরাজয়ের লিখিত স্বীকৃতি হিসেবে বর্ণনা করেন। তিনি বলেন, চুক্তির মাধ্যমে আমেরিকা ক্ষমতা হস্তান্তর করতে বাধ্য হয়েছিল, যদিও শুরুতে তারা আলোচনা এড়িয়ে গিয়েছিল। হাক্কানি জানান, তালিবান পারস্পরিক সমঝোতার মাধ্যমে ক্ষমতায় আসতে চাইলেও সাবেক প্রেসিডেন্ট আশরাফ ঘানির হঠাৎ পলায়ন সেই পরিকল্পনায় পরিবর্তন আনে।
    
    * * *

    [#5](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/সংবাদ/জিহাদ-সংবাদ/209455-মুজাহিদীন-নিউজ-১৯-সফর-১৪৪৭-হিজরী-১৪-আগস্ট-২০২৫-ঈসায়ী​​?p=209460#post209460)
    
    1 week ago
    
    **বুরকিনায় ‘জেএনআইএম’ মুজাহিদিন কর্তৃক শত্রু সামরিক ঘাঁটি বিজয়: নিহত ২০ শত্রু সেনা**
    
    ! <image:4234>
    
      
      
      
    বুরকিনা ফাসোর উয়াহিগুয়া রাজ্যে একটি শত্রু সামরিক ঘাঁটিতে অতর্কিত আক্রমণ চালিয়েছেন আল-কায়েদা সংশ্লিষ্ট জামা’আত নুসরাতুল ইসলাম ওয়াল মুসলিমিন (জেএনআইএম) মুজাহিদিনরা। এতে অন্তত ২০ শত্রু সেনা নিহত হয়েছে বলে জানা গেছে।  
      
    আয-যাল্লাকা মিডিয়ার তথ্য অনুযায়ী, গত ১২ আগস্ট মঙ্গলবার বিকাল, জেএনআইএম’ মুজাহিদিনরা উয়াহিগুয়া রাজ্যের ইয়োবা শহরে একটি শত্রু সামরিক ঘাঁটিতে ভারী অতর্কিত আক্রমণ চালিয়েছেন। মুজাহিদদের অতর্কিত এই অভিযানে শত্রু বাহিনীর অন্তত ২০ সৈন্য নিহত হয়েছে। একই সাথে মুজাহিদদের হাতে এক সৈন্য বন্দী হয়েছে। অন্য জান্তা সদস্যরা জীবন বাঁচাতে সামরিক ঘাঁটি ছেড়ে পালিয়ে গেলে মুজাহিদিনরা ঘাঁটির নিয়ন্ত্রণ নেন।  
      
    এই অভিযান শেষে মুজাহিদিনরা শত্রু সামরিক ঘাঁটি থেকে অসংখ্য অস্ত্র ও সামরিক সরঞ্জাম গনিমত লাভ করেছেন। এসকল গনিমতের মধ্যে রয়েছে ১টি সামরিক যান, ১টি দুশকা মেশিনগান, ১টি আরপিজি, ৪৩টি ক্লাশিনকোভ অ্যাসল্ট রাইফেল, ১৬টি মোটরসাইকেল এবং অন্যান্য বিভিন্ন সরঞ্জাম। এছাড়াও মুজাহিদিনরা শত্রু বাহিনীর একটি বুলডোজারও ধ্বংস করেছেন  
    ​
    
    **নিয়মিত খবর পড়তে ভিজিট করুনঃ [https://alfirdaws.org](https://alfirdaws.org)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The website dawahilallah.com published an article on August 14, 2025, discussing the destruction of two Israeli tanks by Al-Qassam Brigades in Khan Yunis, using Yassin-105 shells and a side IED. <image:4221>. The article also mentions an attack by JNIM (Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin) in Burkina Faso on a military base, resulting in the death of 20 soldiers. <image:4234>. The website also discusses the four-year achievements of the Islamic Emirate in Afghanistan, and a trade agreement between Kyrgyzstan and the Islamic Emirate. <image:4223>, <image:4231>. The website also mentions a statement by the IEA spokesperson regarding the US human rights report on Afghanistan. <image:4228>.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank Jabalia camp Hamas ambush October 2024")
image_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera reported on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, resulting in at least 17 deaths, with tank deployment and evacuation orders (<image:1>). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The Guardian discussed the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces, with the third offensive starting on October 5, 2024, and included satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>).

Wikipedia discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera reports on battles in northern Gaza, mentioning Palestinian fighters ambushing Israeli troops (<image:6423>). PBS NewsHour published an article about Israeli airstrikes in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza (<image:6424>). The BBC News website contains an image of an Israeli tank (<image:6425>).

The provided sources do not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there was an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia in October 2024, and that Hamas fighters were active in the area. Specifically, Wikipedia mentions an ambush by Hamas on October 10, 2024, which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company east of the Jabalia camp. However, the evidence does not directly link the image to this specific event.

Therefore, while the claim's context is supported by the evidence, the image's specific association with the ambush cannot be verified. More information is needed to confirm the image's origin and the circumstances of the tank's destruction.


## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:34>)
```

## Web Sources

The article includes images of the aftermath of the attacks, including destroyed vehicles and buildings <image:4201>. The article also mentions that Hamas launched a surprise attack on October 7, 2023, and that Israel declared a state of war. The article includes a video of a destroyed Israeli tank. The article also includes several advertisements.


From [Source](https://www.nairaland.com/7868168/israel-declares-war-readiness-hamas): Found exact image on website with title: Israel declares war readiness as Hamas springs surprise multiple ...
Content: The image appears on Nairaland, a Nigerian forum, in a thread discussing the October 7, 2023, Hamas attacks on Israel. The thread, created on October 7, 2023, includes reports from various news sources about the attacks and Israel's declaration of war readiness. The image is included in a post from October 7, 2023.


From [Source](https://dawahilallah.com/forum/%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6/%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6-%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6/209455-%E0%A6%AE%E0%A7%81%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%A6%E0%A7%80%E0%A6%A8-%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%89%E0%A6%9C-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AF-%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%AB%E0%A6%B0-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AA%E0%A7%AA%E0%A7%AD-%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%9C%E0%A6%B0%E0%A7%80-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AA-%E0%A6%86%E0%A6%97%E0%A6%B8%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%9F-%E0%A7%A8%E0%A7%A6%E0%A7%A8%E0%A7%AB-%E0%A6%88%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%BE%E0%A7%9F%E0%A7%80%E2%80%8B%E2%80%8B): Found exact image on website with title: মুজাহিদীন নিউজ || ১৯ সফর, ১৪৪৭ হিজরী || ১৪ আগস্ট, ২০২৫ ঈসায়ী
Content: The website dawahilallah.com published an article on August 14, 2025, discussing the destruction of two Israeli tanks by Al-Qassam Brigades in Khan Yunis, using Yassin-105 shells and a side IED. <image:4221>. The article also mentions an attack by JNIM (Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin) in Burkina Faso on a military base, resulting in the death of 20 soldiers. <image:4234>. JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```

The Palestinian Islamic Jihad targeted an Israeli command and control room in Jabalia. The article mentions the involvement of Israeli forces and Hamas fighters in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun. On October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.

Another source, dawahilallah.com, published on August 14, 2025, uses the image to illustrate an attack by Al-Qassam Brigades in Khan Yunis.

# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

However, the image's specific association with the ambush could not be verified. The reverse image search revealed that the image of the burning tank was used in articles discussing the 2023 Hamas attacks on Israel and an attack by Al-Qassam Brigades in Khan Yunis. This indicates that the image is not from October 2024, and therefore the claim is false. `false`
