# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. DW.COM ([https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468](https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468)) reported on January 22, 2025, that the Polish government guaranteed safe passage to Benjamin Netanyahu, should he attend an event in Poland, also mentioning the ICC arrest warrant <image:k>.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.


## Actions
```
web_search("Iran missile attack Israel October 1 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack): 
Content: "Israel says it shot down most of the Iranian missiles.**

Iran carries out a massive missile attack on Israel, expanding the Middle East conflict
=======================================================================================

  

Updated October 1, 20243:33 PM ET Originally published October 1, 202411:27 AM ET

[!Headshot of Hadeel Al-Shalchi <image:279>](https://www.npr.org/people/989929373/hadeel-al-shalchi)

[Hadeel Al-Shalchi](https://www.npr.org/people/989929373/hadeel-al-shalchi)

, 

[!Greg Myre - 2016 - square <image:280>](https://www.npr.org/people/348766539/greg-myre)

[Greg Myre](https://www.npr.org/people/348766539/greg-myre)

  !In this photo, several Israelis lie face down on the ground beside a highway, taking shelter during a massive missile barrage from Iran on October 1, 2024. The strikes have targeted Hezbollah and its weapons, killing Nasrallah and several other top officials, [as well as many civilians](https://www.npr.org/2024/09/27/nx-s1-5130756/israeli-airstrikes-leave-blast-sites-and-wounded-in-lebanons-bekaa-valley)
.

Back in April, an Israeli strike killed several leaders of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps in Damascus, Syria.

Iran responded by [attacking Israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/04/14/1244693369/iran-israel-middle-east-what-to-know)
 with more than 300 drones and missiles, but nearly all were intercepted by Israel and its allies, including the United States. **Maya Levin for NPR** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Maya Levin for NPR

Iran unleashed a major airstrike targeting sites across Israel on Tuesday night, while Israel's air defenses shot down most of the 180 incoming missiles, according to Israeli officials.

The Iranian attack marked the latest escalation in fighting that now stretches into several countries in the region, with warnings that more fighting is likely. They include the assassination of Hezbollah's leader, [Hassan Nasrallah](https://www.npr.org/2024/09/28/g-s1-25302/who-was-hassan-nasrallah-the-hezbollah-leader-killed-by-israel)
, killed last Friday in an airstrike in Beirut; the death of Hamas leader [Ismail Haniyeh](https://www.npr.org/2024/08/01/nx-s1-5059999/hamas-militant-leader-announced-dead-by-israel-military)
, killed in Iran's capital, Tehran, in July; and the earlier death of an Iranian military commander.

Loading...

Iran's mission at the United Nations [said in a statement](https://x.com/Iran_UN/status/1841162849286308106)
 on the social media platform X that Iran carried out a "legal, rational, and legitimate response to the terrorist acts of the Zionist regime." The statement added that "should the Zionist regime dare to respond or commit further acts of malevolence, a subsequent and crushing response will ensue."

Israel's government had warned the public that an attack was coming, and civilians took to bomb shelters nationwide before and during the strike. Accessibility links

**Iran launches major missile attack on Israel** **The Iranian airstrikes come in the wake of stepped-up Israeli military operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah, a group backed by Iran for decades. <image:281>

Israelis shelter on the highway during a massive missile barrage from Iran on Tuesday. Daniel Hagari, said most Iranian missiles were intercepted, though a small number crashed into central and southern Israel.

No Israeli deaths were reported in the airstrike, though the attacks caused some limited damage. destroyers fired a total of 12 interceptors at Iranian missiles as they headed to Israel. <image:282>](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25657/israel-ground-offensive-lebanon)

### [Middle East conflict](https://www.npr.org/series/1205445976/middle-east-crisis)

### [Israel begins ground offensive in Lebanon](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25657/israel-ground-offensive-lebanon)

In a separate development, two gunmen shot dead six people and injured 12 in an attack on a light-rail train in Jaffa, just south of Tel Aviv, according to Israeli authorities. 

### Escalating regional violence

The Iranian strikes come in the wake of an escalating Israeli operation against the militant group Hezbollah in Lebanon, including a [ground campaign](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25657/israel-ground-offensive-lebanon)
 launched Monday."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
NPR reported on October 1, 2024, that Iran launched a major missile attack on Israel. <image:281>. The article mentions that Israel shot down most of the Iranian missiles. The article was written by Hadeel Al-Shalchi and Greg Myre.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. DW.COM ([https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468](https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468)) reported on January 22, 2025, that the Polish government guaranteed safe passage to Benjamin Netanyahu, should he attend an event in Poland, also mentioning the ICC arrest warrant <image:k>.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.


## Actions
```
web_search("Iran missile attack Israel October 1 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next): 
Content: "![Israel's Iron Dome anti-missile system intercepts rockets](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/2024-10-01T172149Z_670485235_RC2TBAAWE4MY_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-LEBANON-1727813081.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

Israel's Iron Dome anti-missile system intercepts rockets, as seen from Ashkelon, Israel, October 1 \[Amir Cohen/Reuters\]

By [Al Jazeera Staff](/author/al_jazeera_staff_150119130629458)

Published On 1 Oct 20241 Oct 2024

Iran has launched an unprecedented attack against Israel, firing a barrage of missiles at the country in [the latest escalation](/news/liveblog/2024/10/1/israels-war-on-gaza-israel-says-it-will-respond-to-iran-missile-attacks)
 amid weeks of soaring violence and tensions in the region.

Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) said on Tuesday that it [fired missiles](/news/2024/10/1/israel-says-iran-launches-missile-attack-warns-residents-to-shelter)
 at Israel in response to deadly Israeli attacks against people in Gaza and Lebanon, as well as the assassinations of top IRGC, Hamas and Hezbollah leaders.

Alarms sounded in Israel on Tuesday evening as the missiles fell on major cities and towns.

Israel and its top ally, [the United States](/news/2024/10/1/us-says-helped-israel-thwart-iranian-attack-reasserts-ironclad-support)
, said their respective militaries worked together to shoot down most of the nearly 200 projectiles that were fired by Iran.

The Israeli army said only a “few” hits were recorded in central and southern parts of the country while two people were injured from falling shrapnel in the Tel Aviv area, according to Israel’s emergency service.

Here’s what we know about the attack, the wider context, and what could come next.

What happened?
--------------

*   The exact details of the Iranian operation remain unclear, but the IRGC said in a statement that the missiles were aimed at “vital military and security targets” in Israel.
*   The IRGC said later that its attack was aimed specifically at three military bases in the Tel Aviv area.
*   The attack, which was accompanied by a large-scale cyberattack, also employed Iran’s new Fatah hypersonic ballistic missiles for the first time, according to Iranian state media.
*   The Israeli military said it intercepted “a large number” of the 180 ballistic missiles launched by Iran, but that there were “isolated” impacts in central and southern Israel. We absolutely need a ceasefire.”

> I condemn the broadening of the Middle East conflict with escalation after escalation.
> 
> This must stop.
> 
> We absolutely need a ceasefire.
> 
> — António Guterres (@antonioguterres) [October 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/antonioguterres/status/1841167889191112704?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

What comes next?
----------------

*   Israeli military spokesperson Daniel Hagari said Israel is “fully prepared to defend and retaliate” against the Iranian attack, stressing that it would be in a “timely manner”.
*   Sullivan, the White House adviser, told reporters that the Biden administration “made clear that there will be consequences — severe consequences — for this attack” by Iran, and the US “will work with Israel to make that the case”.
*   Iran has warned Israel against responding to its attack, threatening to launch further missiles at the country if it retaliates.
*   Raed Jarrar, advocacy director at the US-based think tank DAWN, told Al Jazeera that the Middle East was now in “a full-scale regional war” that will not end without a change in American policy. The IRGC said that 90 percent of the projectiles fired hit their targets.
*   US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said the American military “coordinated closely” with its Israeli counterparts to shoot down the projectiles.
*   “US naval destroyers joined Israeli air defence units in firing interceptors to shoot down inbound missiles,” Sullivan told reporters at the White House.
*   Sullivan said no deaths were reported in Israel: “In short, based on what we know at this point, this attack appears to have been defeated and ineffective,” he said.

What was the attack in response to?
-----------------------------------

*   The IRGC said Tuesday’s attack was in response to the assassination of [Hassan Nasrallah](/news/2024/9/28/israels-military-says-it-has-killed-hezbollah-leader-hassan-nasrallah)
    , the head of Lebanese group Hezbollah, and IRGC commander Abbas Nilforoushan last week in Beirut, as well as the killing of Hamas leader [Ismail Haniyeh](/news/2024/7/31/life-of-defiance-ismail-haniyeh-hamas-political-boss-killed)
     in Tehran in July.
*   Experts have warned over the past year that the Middle East was on the brink of regional war amid Israel’s war on the Gaza Strip, which has killed more than 41,000 Palestinians since October 2023.
*   Lebanese group Hezbollah began firing rockets into northern Israel shortly after the Gaza war began, saying it aimed to support Palestinians in the besieged enclave.
*   The Israeli military has been exchanging fire with Hezbollah across the Israel-Lebanon border since that time, displacing tens of thousands of people in both countries.
*   Over the past month, the Israeli military escalated its attacks on Lebanon, striking targets in the capital Beirut and fuelling more [fears of an all-out war](/news/2024/9/24/disastrous-failure-how-biden-emboldened-israel-to-attack-lebanon)
    .

> Western hypocrisy is not just outrageous, but extremely dangerous. 
> Iran has an inherent… [pic.twitter.com/vVGHcvKgwt](https://t.co/vVGHcvKgwt)
> 
> — Javad Zarif (@JZarif) [October 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/JZarif/status/1841198617895571922?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

How have world leaders reacted to the Iranian attack?
-----------------------------------------------------

*   Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Iran had “made a big mistake” and “will pay for it”.
*   Israel’s envoy to the United Nations, Danny Danon, said the country “will take all necessary measures to protect the citizens of Israel”: “As we have previously made clear to the international community, any enemy that attacks Israel should expect a severe response,” Danon wrote on social media.
*   Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said in a post on X that the attack was a “decisive response” to Israel’s “aggressions”. “Do not enter into a conflict with Iran.”
*   Mohammad Javad Zarif, the strategic adviser to Pezeshkian, said “Iran has an inherent right of self-defence against repeated Israeli armed attacks against Iranian territory and its citizens.”
*   Hamas, the Palestinian group that governs Gaza, welcomed the Iranian attack as “heroic” and said it sent “a strong message to the Zionist enemy and its fascist government that will help deter and rein in their terrorism”.
*   The US pledged its “ironclad” support for Israel, with President Joe Biden saying that his country was “fully, fully, fully supportive of Israel”. State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said Washington would “stand by the people of Israel at this critical moment”.
*   The Pentagon [also said](https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/3922464/readout-of-secretary-of-defense-lloyd-j-austin-iiis-call-with-israeli-minister/)
     US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin and his Israeli counterpart Yoav Gallant had discussed “the severe consequences for Iran” should it launch a “direct military attack” on Israel. 
> Western States have aided and abetted the Israeli genocide in Gaza and acquiesced in Israeli aggressions against Iran, Palestine, Lebanon, Syria, Yemen and other countries in the region. “You’re going to get into the type of retaliatory action, back and forth, that spawns a greater war,” he told Al Jazeera.
*   Rahman added that Israel “has been trying to invite this war” through [its actions](/news/2024/9/20/israel-hits-beirut-lebanon-air-strike-hezbollah-fires-rockets)
     over the past several months. Iran, I think, has tried to avoid that, but it’s on the path to some type of war with Israel.”

Source: Al Jazeera

The Israeli military said it intercepted "a large number" of the 180 ballistic missiles launched by Iran. DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm whether Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on that date. The provided sources only mention Netanyahu's potential travel to Poland in January 2025.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. DW.COM ([https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468](https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468)) reported on January 22, 2025, that the Polish government guaranteed safe passage to Benjamin Netanyahu, should he attend an event in Poland, also mentioning the ICC arrest warrant <image:k>.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.


## Actions
```
web_search("Iran missile attack Israel October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources confirm that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next)) and NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack)) reported on the attack, with Al Jazeera stating it was in response to Israeli actions and NPR noting that Israel intercepted most missiles <image:1>, <image:281>. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel)) also discusses the attack, mentioning that Benjamin Netanyahu called it a "big mistake".


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm whether Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on that date. The provided sources only mention Netanyahu's potential travel to Poland in January 2025.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The fact-check reveals that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, and that Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest in January 2025. However, there is no evidence to confirm whether Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid the missile attack on October 1, 2024.

The claim is `not enough information`.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

...

image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. ## Elaboration

However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.

"Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")<br>    <br>*   [October 2024 Iranian strikes against Israel](/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_against_Israel "October 2024 Iranian strikes against Israel")<br>    <br>*   [2025 Beirut riots](/wiki/2025_Beirut_riots "2025 Beirut riots") |     |

On 19 October 2024, a drone strike took place on the private residence of [Israeli prime minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel "Prime Minister of Israel")
 [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 in the town of [Caesarea](/wiki/Caesarea_(modern_town) "Caesarea (modern town)")
, Israel. This targeting came in the context of ongoing escalation between [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 and the [Axis of Resistance](/wiki/Axis_of_Resistance "Axis of Resistance")
, including [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
, in light of the ongoing [Israeli–Lebanese conflict](/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Lebanese_conflict "Israeli–Lebanese conflict")
.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-:1-3)
[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Attack
------

On 19 October 2024, Benjamin Netanyahu’s home in Caesarea was targeted by one of three drones, believed to have been launched from Lebanon. She reported that sirens had gone off around Caesarea only after the attack on Netanyahu's residence was confirmed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)

Responses
---------

### Israel

Benjamin Netanyahu called the attack an attempted assassination against himself and his wife [Sara Netanyahu](/wiki/Sara_Netanyahu "Sara Netanyahu")
 conducted by Iranian proxies, stating that they had "made a bitter mistake".[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)
 He further stated that the attack would not hinder or dissuade Israel from "the war of revival" against Israel's enemies and to ensure Israel's security for generations.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

[Israeli foreign minister](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Israel) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Israel)")
 [Israel Katz](/wiki/Israel_Katz "Israel Katz")
 also stated that the attack was an assassination attempt against Netanyahu and his family conducted by Iranian proxies, and called the attack another exposure of "Iran’s true face and the evil axis it leads".[\[3\]](#cite_note-:1-3)

### Axis of Resistance

[Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran")
 stated that Hezbollah was responsible for the reported attack, according to the state-run [Islamic Republic News Agency](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_News_Agency "Islamic Republic News Agency")
, which quoted Iran's mission to the UN stating, "The action in question has been carried out by Hezbollah in Lebanon."[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

Hezbollah stated that it had conducted multiple rocket strikes across north and central Israel on the same day of the attack, although it did not explicitly state that it was responsible for the drone attack on Netanyahu's residence.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)
 Hezbollah later claimed responsibility for the attack on 22 October 2024.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

Al Jazeera reporter Nour Odeh called the attack a matter of concern for [Israeli security forces](/wiki/Israeli_security_forces "Israeli security forces")
, due to the fact that the drone successfully struck its intended target 70 kilometers (43 miles) away from the Lebanese border without triggering any sirens.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)

### International

[United States Secretary of Defense](/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_Defense "United States Secretary of Defense")
 [Lloyd Austin](/wiki/Lloyd_Austin "Lloyd Austin")
, after receiving information regarding the attack from [Israel's Minister of Defense](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defense_(Israel) "Ministry of Defense (Israel)")
 [Yoav Gallant](/wiki/Yoav_Gallant "Yoav Gallant")
, was reported to have been "relieved" that Netanyahu survived, and began to review adjustments to United States operations in the Middle East, including the deployment of a [Terminal High-Altitude Area Defense](/wiki/Terminal_High_Altitude_Area_Defense "Terminal High Altitude Area Defense")
 system to bolster Israeli defense against the Axis of Resistance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:1-3)

[British Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom "Prime Minister of the United Kingdom")
 [Sir Keir Starmer](/wiki/Keir_Starmer "Keir Starmer")
 held a call with Netanyahu following the attack, expressing alarm at the use of drones.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

See also
--------

*   [2024 Houthi drone attack on Tel Aviv](/wiki/2024_Houthi_drone_attack_on_Israel "2024 Houthi drone attack on Israel")
    
*   [October 2024 Bachoura airstrike](/wiki/October_2024_Bachoura_airstrike "October 2024 Bachoura airstrike")
    
*   [October 2024 central Beirut medical center airstrike](/wiki/October_2024_central_Beirut_medical_center_airstrike "October 2024 central Beirut medical center airstrike")

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. DW.COM ([https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468](https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468)) reported on January 22, 2025, that the Polish government guaranteed safe passage to Benjamin Netanyahu, should he attend an event in Poland, also mentioning the ICC arrest warrant <image:k>.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.


## Actions
```
web_search("Iran missile attack Israel October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources confirm that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next)) and NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack)) reported on the attack, with Al Jazeera stating it was in response to Israeli actions and NPR noting that Israel intercepted most missiles <image:1>, <image:281>. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel)) also discusses the attack, mentioning that Benjamin Netanyahu called it a "big mistake".


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm whether Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on that date. The provided sources only mention Netanyahu's potential travel to Poland in January 2025.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu whereabouts October 1 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel): 
Content: "Hezbollah said it carried out rocket attacks on Israel, while Israel launched airstrikes on Beirut's suburbs.**

A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah
=====================================================================================

  

Updated October 19, 20248:20 PM ET Originally published October 19, 20248:58 AM ET

By 

[The Associated Press](https://www.npr.org/people/101453150/the-associated-press)

  ![Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday.](https://npr.brightspotcdn.com/dims3/default/strip/false/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/1100/quality/50/format/jpeg/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnpr-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F18%2F69%2Fadab70ff48b998e2d85d43519f09%2Fap24293460216640.jpg)

Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday. **Hussein Malla/AP** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Hussein Malla/AP

JERUSALEM — Israel's government said a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house Saturday, with no casualties, as fighting with Lebanon-based Hezbollah and Gaza-based Hamas showed no pause after the [killing of the Hamas mastermind](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)
 of last year’s Oct. <image:6655>](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/17/nx-s1-5155887/hamas-yahya-sinwar-israel-gaza)

### [Who was Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar?](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/17/nx-s1-5155887/hamas-yahya-sinwar-israel-gaza)

*   [Israel](https://www.npr.org/tags/125940539/israel)
    
*   [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://www.npr.org/tags/135373099/benjamin-netanyahu)

“The proxies of Iran who today tried to assassinate me and my wife made a bitter mistake,” Netanyahu said.

### [Middle East conflict](https://www.npr.org/series/1205445976/middle-east-crisis)

### [What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)

Hezbollah didn't claim responsibility but said it carried out several rocket attacks on Israel. The militant group’s longtime leader, Hassan Nasrallah, was [killed in an Israeli airstrike](https://www.npr.org/2024/09/28/g-s1-25311/analysis-hassan-nasrallahs-killing-transforms-an-already-deadly-regional-conflict)
 in September, and Israel sent ground troops into Lebanon this month.

A 50-year-old man was hit by shrapnel and killed in northern Israel, and four other people were wounded, Israel’s medical services said.

Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency said an Israeli airstrike on an apartment in eastern Baaloul village killed five people, including the mayor of nearby Sohmor village. <image:6654>](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/15/nx-s1-5154065/israel-north-gaza-food-aid-block)

### [Israel threatens to starve out northern Gaza, U.N. aid agencies say](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/15/nx-s1-5154065/israel-north-gaza-food-aid-block)

The Palestinian Health Ministry said Israeli strikes hit the upper floors of the Indonesian Hospital in Beit Lahiya, and forces opened fire at it, causing panic. Accessibility links

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
NPR reported on October 19, 2024, that a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house in Caesarea, Israel, with no casualties. The article mentions that Netanyahu stated that "proxies of Iran" tried to assassinate him. <image:6655>, <image:6651>, <image:6654>.

[![Prime Minister Benjmain Netanyahu leads a cabinet meeting in Jerusalem, Oct. 7, 2024. 7, 2024. 7, 2024. (Amos Ben Gershom/GPO)

The cabinet met Monday in an underground secure location in Jerusalem’s governmental complex and not at the Prime Minister’s Office due to security concerns, at the recommendation of the Shin Bet.

The decision was made due to an increase in threats against senior Israeli officials and in light of last week’s Hezbollah drone attack on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home.

Government sources told news outlets that the move would not be a one-time event, and that cabinet meetings are expected to be held in changing locations for the near future due to the same security concerns.

Ministers were notified of the decision only in the morning, and were told that their advisers would not be allowed in due to the constraints of the space.

Three drones were launched from Lebanon in the attack on Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea earlier this month. <image:6670>

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Times of Israel reported that on October 1, 2024, Iran launched a ballistic missile barrage at Israel. The article also mentions that on October 19, 2024, Hezbollah launched a drone attack on Netanyahu's home in Caesarea <image:6664>. Following the drone attack, cabinet meetings were moved to a secure underground location due to security concerns. The article also mentions that Netanyahu led a cabinet meeting in Jerusalem on October 7, 2024.

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. DW.COM ([https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468](https://www.dw.com/en/auschwitz-poland-netanyahu-arrest-pledge/a-71377468)) reported on January 22, 2025, that the Polish government guaranteed safe passage to Benjamin Netanyahu, should he attend an event in Poland, also mentioning the ICC arrest warrant <image:k>.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that in January 2025, Poland was prepared to protect Netanyahu from potential arrest. This suggests that Netanyahu was expected to be in Poland around that time. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.


## Actions
```
web_search("Iran missile attack Israel October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources confirm that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next)) and NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack)) reported on the attack, with Al Jazeera stating it was in response to Israeli actions and NPR noting that Israel intercepted most missiles <image:1>, <image:281>. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel)) also discusses the attack, mentioning that Benjamin Netanyahu called it a "big mistake".


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm whether Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on that date. The provided sources only mention Netanyahu's potential travel to Poland in January 2025.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu whereabouts October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/cabinet-meeting-moved-to-secure-underground-location-after-drone-attack-on-pms-home/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/cabinet-meeting-moved-to-secure-underground-location-after-drone-attack-on-pms-home/)) reported that on October 1, 2024, Iran launched a ballistic missile barrage at Israel. The article also mentions that on October 19, 2024, Hezbollah launched a drone attack on Netanyahu's home in Caesarea <image:6664>. NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel)) reported on October 19, 2024, that a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house in Caesarea, Israel, with no casualties <image:6655>, <image:6651>, <image:6654>. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence)) discusses the drone attack on Netanyahu's residence on October 19, 2024 <image:1>.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that on October 1, 2024, Iran launched a missile attack on Israel. The Times of Israel reported that on October 19, 2024, Hezbollah launched a drone attack on Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. However, the evidence does not state that Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on October 1, 2024.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/poland-says-it-will-protect-benjamin-netanyahu-from-potential-arrest)) reported on January 9, 2025, that Poland will protect Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest, referencing an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) <image:1>. The Polish government adopted a resolution allowing senior Israeli officials, including Netanyahu, to travel freely to Poland for the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp on January 27, 2025.

The Los Angeles Times ([https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event](https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-01-09/polish-president-seeks-protection-for-netanyahu-if-he-attends-auschwitz-anniversary-event)) also reported on January 9, 2025, that the Polish President is seeking protection for Benjamin Netanyahu if he attends the Auschwitz anniversary event <image:k>. However, the provided evidence does not mention anything about an Iranian missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, nor does it confirm that Netanyahu fled to Poland on that date.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified based on the provided evidence. The evidence is missing information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024, and any connection to an Iranian missile attack.

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources confirm that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024. Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/1/irans-missile-attack-against-israel-what-we-know-and-what-comes-next)) and NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/01/g-s1-25707/iran-israel-hezbollah-lebanon-attack)) reported on the attack, with Al Jazeera stating it was in response to Israeli actions and NPR noting that Israel intercepted most missiles <image:1>, <image:281>. Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about Netanyahu's whereabouts on October 1, 2024.

```
web_search("Netanyahu whereabouts October 1 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/cabinet-meeting-moved-to-secure-underground-location-after-drone-attack-on-pms-home/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/cabinet-meeting-moved-to-secure-underground-location-after-drone-attack-on-pms-home/)) reported that on October 1, 2024, Iran launched a ballistic missile barrage at Israel. The article also mentions that on October 19, 2024, Hezbollah launched a drone attack on Netanyahu's home in Caesarea <image:6664>. NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel)) reported on October 19, 2024, that a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house in Caesarea, Israel, with no casualties <image:6655>, <image:6651>, <image:6654>. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence)) discusses the drone attack on Netanyahu's residence on October 19, 2024 <image:1>.


## Elaboration

The Times of Israel reported that on October 19, 2024, Hezbollah launched a drone attack on Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. However, the evidence does not state that Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on October 1, 2024.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified.


## Final Judgement
The evidence confirms that Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, and that Netanyahu's home was targeted by a drone attack on October 19, 2024. However, there is no evidence to support the claim that Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland on October 1, 2024.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. While Iran launched a missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024, and Netanyahu's home was targeted by a drone attack later that month, there is no evidence to support the assertion that Netanyahu fled to Poland on October 1, 2024. The provided sources, such as the [Times of Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/cabinet-meeting-moved-to-secure-underground-location-after-drone-attack-on-pms-home/) and [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel), detail the attacks but do not mention Netanyahu's departure to Poland.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

```

```

...

image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:50> This image shows Israel's 9/11 memorial which is the only one outside the US."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

[Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system")
: [31°48′24″N 35°10′44″E﻿ / ﻿31.80667°N 35.17889°E﻿ / 31.80667; 35.17889](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&params=31_48_24_N_35_10_44_E_region:IL_type:landmark)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Israeli monument in the Arazim Valley of Jerusalem

|     |     |
| --- | --- |9/11 Living Memorial Plaza
| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Twin_Towers_Memorial_in_Israel.jpg/250px-Twin_Towers_Memorial_in_Israel.jpg)](/wiki/File:Twin_Towers_Memorial_in_Israel.jpg)<br><br>Cenotaph of the complex: an [American flag](/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_States "Flag of the United States")<br> morphing into a [flame of remembrance](/wiki/Candlelight_vigil "Candlelight vigil") |     |
| [![Map](https://maps.wikimedia.org/img/osm-intl,13,31.806666666667,35.178888888889,250x200.png?lang=en&domain=en.wikipedia.org&title=9%2F11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&revid=1286276248&groups=_48a98e9381b706e57ffc5e7da39d009916ba0860)](/wiki/Special:Map/13/31.806666666667/35.178888888889/en) |     |
| Location | [West Jerusalem](/wiki/West_Jerusalem "West Jerusalem")<br>, Israel |
| Coordinates | [31°48′24″N 35°10′44″E﻿ / ﻿31.80667°N 35.17889°E﻿ / 31.80667; 35.17889](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&params=31_48_24_N_35_10_44_E_region:IL_type:landmark) |
| Designer | [Eliezer Weishoff](/wiki/Eliezer_Weishoff "Eliezer Weishoff") |
| Material | Granite, bronze, aluminum |
| Opening date | 12 November 2009 |
| Dedicated to | Victims of the [September 11 attacks](/wiki/September_11_attacks "September 11 attacks") |

The **9/11 Living Memorial Plaza** ([Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_language "Hebrew language")
: האנדרטה לזכר קרבנות אסון מגדלי התאומים) consists of an Israeli [cenotaph](/wiki/Cenotaph "Cenotaph")
 surrounded by a larger complex near [Ramot, Jerusalem](/wiki/Ramot,_East_Jerusalem "Ramot, East Jerusalem")
. It was built on 5 acres (2.0 ha) of land, having been completed in 2009, and had been designed by Israeli artist [Eliezer Weishoff](/wiki/Eliezer_Weishoff "Eliezer Weishoff")
 to honour the victims of the [September 11 attacks](/wiki/September_11_attacks "September 11 attacks")
, which were carried out by [al-Qaeda](/wiki/Al-Qaeda "Al-Qaeda")
 against the [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")
 in 2001.

Construction
------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Construction")\
\]

[![The 9/11 Living Memorial Plaza Complex](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/911MemorialEmekHaArazimSept202022_01.jpg/250px-911MemorialEmekHaArazimSept202022_01.jpg)](/wiki/File:911MemorialEmekHaArazimSept202022_01.jpg)

The 9/11 Living Memorial Plaza Complex

The cenotaph measures 30 feet and is made of granite, bronze, and aluminum. Cunningham")
, members of the Israeli Cabinet and legislature, the families of victims and others.[\[1\]](#cite_note-JPost-1)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-Haaretz-5)

Commemorations
--------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: Commemorations")\
\]

The 2013 memorial for the 9/11 attacks was commemorated at Living Memorial Plaza. Shapiro")
 commented during the ceremony: "Here, at this painfully beautiful memorial site, we are a reminder to everyone that we, Americans and Israelis, stand together in a spirit of solidarity and commitment to the future."[\[1\]](#cite_note-JPost-1)

In Israeli society
------------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: In Israeli society")\
\]

Israel has issued postage stamps with the 9/11 Living Memorial Plaza pictured, as a tribute to the World Trade Center victims. Also, Israel Coins and Medals Corp issues medal for 9/11 victims with the image of Living Memorial.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

Additional monuments
--------------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: Additional monuments")\
\]

Following the 2018 [Pittsburgh synagogue shooting](/wiki/Pittsburgh_synagogue_shooting "Pittsburgh synagogue shooting")
, the Jewish National Fund and JNF-USA erected a stone plaque listing the names of the 11 victims of that attack next to the 9/11 Living Memorial Plaza. In February 2019, Pittsburgh mayor [Bill Peduto](/wiki/Bill_Peduto "Bill Peduto")
 visited the synagogue memorial and planted an olive tree beside it "as a symbol of peace and continuity".[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

# Search Result
From [Source](http://www.memorialmapping.com/memorials/9-11-living-memorial-plaza): 
Content: "[Memorial Mapping: Transnational 9/11 Memorials](/)

====================================================

[Memorial Mapping: Transnational 9/11 Memorials](/)

====================================================

9/11 Living Memorial Plaza
==========================

[Memorial Mapping: Transnational 9/11 Memorials](/)

====================================================

9/11 Living Memorial Plaza
==========================

!Jerusalem memorial 1.jpg <image:2231> !Jerusalem memorial 2.JPG <image:2232> !Jerusalem memorial 3.jpg <image:2233> !Jerusalem memorial 4.jpg <image:2234> !Jerusalem memorial 5.jpg <image:2235> !Jerusalem memorial 6.jpg <image:2236>

**Location:** Ramot, Jerusalem, [Israel](/memorials/browse-by-country/israel)

**Dedication Date:** November 12, 2009

**Creator:** Designed by Eliezer Weishoff, commissioned by Jewish National Fund

**Medium:** [Stone](/memorials/browse-by-medium/stone)
 (granite), [metal](/memorials/browse-by-medium/metal)
 ([WTC fragment](https://memorial-mapping.squarespace.com/memorials/browse-by-medium/wtc-fragments)
, bronze, aluminum)

**Description:** 30-foot high bronze sculture of waving American flag transforming into flame rests on granite base, part of which was taken from Twin Towers site, in round courtyard that can hold about 300 people for ceremonies. This metal piece, like the entire monument, is a manifestation of the special relationship between New York and Jerusalem and an expression of gratitude to Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael-Jewish National Fund whose initiative and the generous contribution of its supporters made this monument possible."

**Latitude & Longitude:** 31.806667, 35.178889

Image source: [Wikimedia Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9/11_Living_Memorial_Plaza)

[! It was sent over to Israel by the City of New York to be incorporated into this memorial. Located in contested territory (Arazim Valley, Ramot), on outskirts of Jerusalem. 

**Text:** "A reminder of shared loss and a call for peace among nations dedicated by Edward Blank, Sharon Cosloy Blank, Rebecca Blank, Michael Blank, May Cohn."

"This metal remnant was taken from the remains fo the Twin Towers that imploded in the September 11, 2001 disaster."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is about the 9/11 Living Memorial Plaza in Jerusalem, Israel. It includes several images of the memorial <image:2231>, <image:2232>, <image:2233>, <image:2234>, <image:2235>, <image:2236>. The memorial was dedicated on November 12, 2009. It is a 30-foot high bronze sculpture of a waving American flag transforming into a flame. A metal remnant from the Twin Towers is incorporated into the memorial.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.kkl-jnf.org/tourism-and-recreation/scenic-lookouts/center/twin-towers-living-memorial-jerusalem-park.aspx): 
Content: "  

[](/?catid=%7BE4819479-E363-4E8D-A5C6-82DFC827CC30%7D "Link to external site")

KKL-JNF Tourism Notifications
-----------------------------

[](https://www.kkl-jnf.org/tourism-and-recreation/messages/)

Additional info

Close Notifications

9/11 Living Memorial
====================

Click here to print

[](mailto:?Subject=KKL_New-9/11 Living Memorial&Body=https%3a%2f%2fwww.kkl-jnf.org%2ftourism-and-recreation%2fscenic-lookouts%2fcenter%2ftwin-towers-living-memorial-jerusalem-park.aspx "SHARE MAIL")

Click here to share

**Hebrew name:** Andartat HaTeomim  
  
**Location:** Jerusalem Park  
  
**Description:** An memorial established by KKL-JNF in the heart of Natua Forest, on top of a hill overlooking Ha’arazim Valley and Nahal Soreq. 
  
**Directions:** From Golda Meir Avenue in Jerusalem (Route 436), for those coming from the north, near the Golda Meir Interchange.

The 9/11 Twin Towers Living Memorial in Jerusalem Park. 
Memorial plaques on the wall around the plaza commemorate the nearly 3000 names of people who perished in the disaster, including five Israelis. 
Below the memorial is the Einot Telem National Park, featuring small springs that flow from the stone precipice, and the remains of the small Jewish settlement Beit Talma, which was built in 1906 and eventually abandoned. In the heart of this plaza, artist Eliezer Weishoff has installed a large 9-meter tall bronze sculpture."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from KKL-JNF describes the 9/11 Twin Towers Living Memorial in Jerusalem Park. The memorial is located in Jerusalem Park and was established by KKL-JNF. The memorial includes plaques commemorating the victims of the 9/11 attacks, including five Israelis. <image:50>
